intro: Nauclea robinsonii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, flame-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Nauclea robinsonii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
